Always felt 'broken' or 'lazy' when actually dealing with undiagnosed executive dysfunction
Exhausted from masking ADHD symptoms their whole lives just to appear 'normal'
Relationship struggles because partners and family don't understand time blindness and emotional dysregulation
Career derailed by ADHD - job losses, missed promotions, being labeled 'unreliable' or 'scattered'

Afraid of being dismissed as unqualified because they're not therapists or psychologists
terminology: Neurodivergence - brain wiring that differs from neurotypical patterns, including ADHD, autism, dyslexia
Executive function - mental skills including working memory, flexible thinking, time management, organization, self-control
D.E.P.T.H. Method - Discover, Educate, Plan, Track, Harmonize framework for ADHD coaching
Time blindness - ADHD-related difficulty perceiving and managing time, common in women
Hyperfocus - intense concentration on engaging tasks while struggling with less stimulating ones
Dopamine - neurotransmitter that's lower/differently regulated in ADHD brains, affects motivation and reward
Emotional dysregulation - intense emotional responses and difficulty managing feelings, often overlooked in women
Masking - consciously or unconsciously hiding ADHD symptoms to fit neurotypical expectations
Rejection Sensitive Dysphoria (RSD) - extreme emotional pain from perceived rejection or criticism
Body doubling - having another person present to help maintain focus and task completion
Scope of practice - support ADHD management and life skills without diagnosing or treating medical conditions
clientExamples: Women 40-55 who were diagnosed with ADHD later in life and are processing years of struggle
Professional women whose careers have been impacted by unmanaged ADHD symptoms
Moms who recognized their own ADHD after their child was diagnosed
Women in relationships where partners don't understand their ADHD and conflict is increasing
High-achieving women who've masked their ADHD but are burning out from the effort
Anyone who describes feeling scattered, overwhelmed, or like they're 'failing at adulting'
practiceType: ADHD coaching focused on executive function strategies, time management systems, emotional regulation tools, and helping clients work WITH their neurodivergent brains instead of against them
